verses.name: Psalms 41:1
verses.text: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble.

verses.name: Psalms 41:2
verses.text: The Lord will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 41:3
verses.text: The Lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

verses.name: Psalms 41:4
verses.text: I said, Lord, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

verses.name: Psalms 41:5
verses.text: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

verses.name: Psalms 41:6
verses.text: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

verses.name: Psalms 41:7
verses.text: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

verses.name: Psalms 41:8
verses.text: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

verses.name: Psalms 41:9
verses.text: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

verses.name: Psalms 41:10
verses.text: But thou, O Lord, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

verses.name: Psalms 41:11
verses.text: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

verses.name: Psalms 41:12
verses.text: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

verses.name: Psalms 41:13
verses.text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
